Your goal is to maximize your long-term profit across multiple games. You need to understand the game mechanics, analyze other players' strategies, and make optimal decisions.

GAME MECHANICS:
The game works like this: every player including you will negotiate and decide how you will split the total prize pool. - First 6 columns: How each agent plans to split the prize pool (must sum to 100%)
- Next 6 columns: Their votes (each agent gets 100 votes to split across proposals, must sum to 100)
- Next 6 columns: Their requests of votes from others

You can read all other agents' plans by reading the matrix and make estimates about how you should behave optimally based on what they say in the matrix. You can only update your matrix 1 time per round of negotiation.

GAME PHASES:
1. NEGOTIATION: Update matrix with your strategy
2. PROPOSAL: Make a proposal (comma-separated list summing to 100%)
3. VOTING: Allocate 100 votes across all proposals

WINNING CONDITION:
A proposal must receive at least 61% of votes to pass and end the game. If no proposal gets 61%, the proposal with the fewest votes gets eliminated (that player can no longer make proposals but can still vote).
